alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 30 at 8:21PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is possible. * WHERE...The Mendenhall Lake and River, areas around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge. * WHEN...Through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There are preliminary indications from the web cameras above the glacier that a glacier-dammed lake outburst flood has started. - If the basin fully drains, a crest above 11 feet is likely over the next two days. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall River, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
